(Gujarati: વલસાડ) is a city in the
and the administrative capital of Valsad district. It's famous for its mango orchards and an increasingly popular destination with a nice beach and several temples.
June-July, post monsoon, is the best time to head to Valsad, as the roads in and around the city are accessible best.

value: Tithal Bach, located 4 km out of town, is the main tourist attraction.

There are several temples of interest, some along the coast. Shri Sai Baba is located right next to the popular beach and its daily prayers can get crowded with beach visitors. Shri Swami Narayan is a bit further long the coast (around 1,5 km) and has great hand carvings.
